column4: I've got a problem compiling the driver for ipw3954. It says Your kernel contains ieee80211 symbol definitions and you
are not using the kernel's default ieee80211 subsystem.  (Perhaps you
used the out-of-tree ieee80211 subsystem's 'make install' or have
provided a path to the ieee80211 subsystem via IEEE80211_INC.)
This is strange. I don't have any driver for the wireless now
upgraded kernel or something?
bah youre compiling nm
I upgraded to 2.6.17-generic yesterday
soo if module is loaded does it show up when you ifconfig?
No. nothing there
It seems I need something else?
if in edgy might rm /bin/sh  then ln -s /bin/bash /bin/sh  or something
Strange. /bin/sh and /bin/bash differ!
Gosh! When did they change this to dash?
in edgy dapper is still bash
Why? This will cause a lot of confusion
i gather dash has some advantages.. ive never used it
I compiled it. but running modprobe ipw3945 gives the error: sh: /sbin/ipw3945d-2.6.17-10-generic: No such file or directory
xmms
amarok is nice but bloated imo
amarok can't work well in gnome
